alert.note: Alert for Blue Earth; Faribault (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Faribault and southeastern Blue Earth Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 601 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vernon Center, or 17 miles southwest of Mankato, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mapleton around 620 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Minnesota Lake and Delavan. This includes U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 27 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
